<title level="2" right="Creature 13">[Kannitri](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1455)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Unique" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=161" />
<trait label="LN" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Ghost" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=217" />
<trait label="Incorporeal" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=222" />
<trait label="Spirit" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=149" />
<trait label="Undead" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=160" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #166: Despair on Danger Island](/Sources.aspx?ID=85) pg. 19</row>

**Perception** +26; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12)

**Languages**
[Tien](/Languages.aspx?ID=43)

**Skills**
[Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +26, [Irori Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +24, [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11) +24, [Temple Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +24

<row gap="medium">
**Str** -5

**Dex** +5

**Con** +0

**Int** +3

**Wis** +6

**Cha** +7
</row>

**Site Bound** A typical ghost can stray only a short distance from where it was killed or the place it haunts. A typical limit is 120 feet. Some ghosts are instead bound to a room, building, item, or creature that was special to it rather than a location.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 33 

**Fort** +19 

**Ref** +24 

**Will** +25 

</row>

**HP** 175
([negative healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=42), rejuvenation)

**Immunities**
[death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), precision, [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38)

**Resistances**
all damage 10 (except [force](/Traits.aspx?ID=75), [_ghost touch_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=297), or [positive](/Traits.aspx?ID=128); double resistance vs. non-[magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103))

**Rejuvenation** ([divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117)) When a ghost is destroyed, it re-forms after 2d4 days within the location it's bound to, fully healed. A ghost can be permanently destroyed only if someone determines the reason for its existence and sets right whatever prevents the spirit from resting. Burying Kannitri's remains in the courtyard or carving her name into the pagoda sculpture there (area A3) permanently puts her spirit to rest.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** fly 40 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
ghostly fist +28 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)),
**Damage** 3d8+13 negative

**Corrupting Gaze** <actions string="Two Actions" />  The ghost stares at a creature it can see within 30 feet. The target takes 7d6 negative damage with a DC 33 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Will save. A creature that fails its save is also [stupefied 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=37) for 1 minute.

**Draining Touch** <actions string="Two Actions" />  With a touch, the ghost attempts to drain a living creature's life force. It makes a ghostly hand Strike but deals no damage on a hit. Instead, the target becomes [drained 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=10) for 1 day, and the ghost regains HP equal to half its own level.

**Flurry of Blows** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Flourish](/Traits.aspx?ID=73)) Kannitri makes two Strikes with her ghostly fist. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses.

</column>
